choices.B: Contact support and provide them with the Agent ID (AID) for the machine and they will put it on the Disabled Hosts list in your Customer ID (CID)

choices.A: Create an exclusion rule and apply it to the machine or group of machines
choices.C: You cannot disable all detections on individual hosts as it would put them at risk

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Allowed IPs are configured within a Network Containment Policy

comments.content: I am sorry it should be D. I have explained what IP allowlist management.

discussion.content: This should be B.By default, user access is not limited by IP address. You can configure the IP allowlist to restrict access to specific IP addresses and help ensure your account is only accessed from specific networks. When a user attempts to sign in through the Falcon console or the CrowdStrike API, their IP address is evaluated against the allowlist. Access from unlisted IP addresses is denied.
